title: Tosafot on Ketubot
text: And if you will say, "but we learned that the spouse of a priest or a girl (who got married at an age) less than 3 have only one doubt!", like we will say in the Gemara later on, "but other women have a doubt on the doubt! So why should they get married on Wednesday? And the Rabenu Tam responds: The rabbis do not differentiate (the cases of) the decree. And because of the spouse of a priest and the girl (who got married at an age) less than 3, we decree for all women to get married on Wednesday. ---Incomplete---

The bride as she is: And if she has a blemish, they are quiet and they do not praise it. And also (another possibility is) they praise her with something pleasant that she has - for example, [he praises her] about her eyes or her hands if they are beautiful. And Beit Hillel says that you praise her altogether, as when we mention that which she has to be praised, it implies that the rest is to be denigrated.

He says to go up [to the Land of Israel], etc.: It is not practiced in our times, as there is danger on the roads. And Rabbenu Chaim says that today, it is not a commandment to live in the Land of Israel, as there are several commandments that are dependent upon the land - and several punishments - that we are not able to be careful about and to be cognizant of.
